Due to the orders of Your Excellency on the 27th of last month, at 7 o'clock in the evening, with eighty cavalrymen with their officers and forty horses, and over a hundred men from the 8th Battalion, under the command of Major Francisco Félix da Fonseca, on the steamship “Liberal,” and two boats for carrying animals, and a gunboat under the command of 1st Lieutenant Rodrigo Antônio de Lamare.

And proceeding to the village of Triunfo and observing the instructions of Your Excellency from the sea; while I unexpectedly proceeded by land I encountered a rebel party commanded by a Lieutenant Colonel Morais; they were legally defeated, with the said commander escaping, leaving behind a saddled horse, a bag, and clothing; a surgeon, a mulatto, and two black men were captured, and I believe one of them is a captive; a lieutenant from the Cachoeira named Damasceno and two black lancers were killed; and Lieutenant Caldeira, or Juca Custódio, was shot in the torso; and there was no novelty among the legal forces. We captured over sixty horses from the rebels, some tack, and some armament; and then immediately proceeding to the village of Triunfo by land, I found nothing, because the enemy, being fearful, had retreated with everything; I rounded up some cattle, which I soon had pass and horses to the island of Paciência, and everything was well embarked near the mouth of the arroio dos Ratos.
